text: at riot games we build game servers in
aws
and in our own metal colos for the
global launch of riots vallarant
our new team-based tactical shooter we
needed to rethink
how we deployed our game servers
worldwide to ensure competitive
integrity
one of the most pervasive technical
challenges in competitive shooters
is peeker's advantage which is caused by
latency
simply put peeker's advantage rewards
aggressive play because the defending
player
is always reacting on a delay and for
riot
any problem that creates a lack of
fairness is a problem worth solving
in the past we worked with co-location
partners to deploy our game servers
in geographic locations not close to an
aws region
to reduce latency for our players with
the demand signal during our closed beta
we recognized that our developers would
need to spin up more capacity
super fast and for that we wanted a
better more seamless hybrid solution
we shipped aws outposts to new colos
quickly
enabling a rapid deployment of game
servers standardized on a single build
test and production pipeline
and best of all using aws outposts we
reduce latency for players by
10 to 20 milliseconds minimizing
peaker's advantage
and creating a level playing field for
all players with outposts
aws gave us a unique solution to ensure
a level playing field for our players
and streamlined our deployments using
the same tools and apis
on-premises and in the cloud we rolled
out valorent fast and efficiently
and we are continuing to reinvent how we
design and deploy our games
to provide our players with the best
possible game experience
you
